summary: Child async cancellation incorrectly propagates to parent scope, preventing further operations like timers or activity calls. The parent scope becomes marked as cancelled after cancelling a child async, causing CancelFailure errors.
userImpact: Users cannot cancel child asyncs without affecting parent workflow execution, breaking expected async isolation patterns.
rootCause: Parent scope is incorrectly marked as cancelled when child async is cancelled, likely due to improper scope state management during cancellation propagation.
workaround: Starting an empty async after cancellation appears to reset scope state, allowing subsequent operations to work.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved by implementing proper try-catch handling for cancelled child workflows; cancellation requires explicit exception handling in child scope.
keyQuote: once the child is cancelled, the parent scope also becomes cancelled and thus any timer or activity call leads to CancelFailure error
